Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains many small black inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate XCV n. 284
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394001) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394001)
